original: Lohmander, Hans Gustav, fik lic., museiamanuens, Göteborg, f. 30/5/96 i Hälsingborg av fil. dr Carl Ludvig L, o. Lydia Andersson. G. 24 m. Stella Nilsson. Barn: Bengt f. 31. — Stud:-ex. i Linköp. 16, fil. kand. i Lund 30, fil. lic. där 34. Förest, f. Gbgs musei geolog.-mineralog. avd. sed. 32, ord. aman. v. Naturhist. museet i Gbg sed. 36. Föret, ett flertail resor i grann-länd. o. Tyskl. Skr.: talrika skr. om sv. o. uti. landmollusker, landisopoder, myriopoder, spindlar m. m., i synnerh. om Sovjetunionens myriopodfauna.
translated: Lohmander, Hans Gustav, received his doctorate in philosophy, assistant curator at the Gothenburg Museum. Born on May 30, 1896 in Helsingborg, son of Dr. Carl Ludvig Lohmander and Lydia Andersson. Married to Stella Nilsson since 1924. They have a son named Bengt, born in 1931. Hans completed his secondary education in Linköping in 1916, and obtained a Bachelor of Arts degree in Lund in 1930. He received his doctorate in philosophy there in 1934. From 1932, he worked as the head of the geological-mineralogical department at the Gothenburg Museum, and from 1936 as a regular assistant at the Museum of Natural History in Gothenburg. He undertook several trips to neighboring countries and Germany. He has written numerous articles on Swedish and international mollusks, isopods, arthropods, spiders, and particularly on the myriopod fauna of the Soviet Union.

structured.name: Hans Gustav Lohmander

department.name: Museum of Natural History in Gothenburg

structured.description: Hans Gustav Lohmander was a Swedish scientist and researcher. He specialized in the fields of mollusks, isopods, arthropods, and spiders, with a particular focus on the myriopod fauna of the Soviet Union.
